data.text:
Thomas “Tom” Hagan, 89, Gladstone, MO, passed away February 3, 2011. Visitation will be held 6-7 p.m., Friday, February 11, 2011, at Northminster Presbyterian Church, 1441 NE Englewood Rd, Kansas City, MO 64118. Memorial services will follow at 7 p.m. at the church. The family requests in lieu of flowers that donations be made to the Longbine family; NYAH, a cousin, was born with Treacher-Collins disorder. We ask that contributions on her behalf be made directly to her mother to help defray cost associated with future surgeries: Heather Longbine, 1112 N. Church St. McKinney, Texas 75069. Such gifts are not tax deductible. Memorial gifts may also be made to Northminster Presbyterian Church. Tom was born October

12, 1921 in Tyler, TX. He was an Army Air Corps, WWII Veteran. Tom founded Tom Hagan & Associates, a banking personnel and training service. He was a member of the ABA and an elder at Northminster Presbyterian Church. Tom was preceded in death by; sons, Patrick Marquess Hagan and Michael O. Hagan. Survivors include; wife of 68 years, Dottie (Ferguson) Hagan, of the home; son & daughter in law, Russ & Charlee Hagan, Ft Worth, TX; granddaughters, Jackie Hagan Novas, Shady Shores, TX, Elizabeth Hagan McLain, Jakarta, Indonesia, Carrie Smyth Sinosic, Udyaliah, Saudi Arabia; and grandson, Capt Morgan Smyth USMC, Camp Pendelton, CA.
